တိဿဒတ္တ（တိ）
[anipphannapāṭipadika]
[အနိပ္ဖန္နပါဋိပဒိကပုဒ်]

Tissadatta：A thera of Ceylon who had special charge of the Vinaya （Vin．v．3）．He may be identical with the Tissadatta mentioned （VibhA．387，389； MA．i．234） as being able to preach in eighteen different languages，explaining the text of the Tipitaka．



On one occasion，wishing to salute the Bodhi-tree by means of his iddhi-power，he caused it to draw near to him．Vsm．403．
